text.tspan: TODO: Make sure to exclude no files (not rewriting) in file jgross-thesis.tex
on input line 54.
TODO: Run `make update-thesis' before submission to update the date on the
cover page in file jgross-thesis.tex on input line 91.
TODO: change \string ^Linalfalse to \string ^Linaltrue in file
jgross-thesis.tex on input line 91.
TODO: Is the ``department committee chairman'' still Leslie A. Kolodziejski?
in file cover.tex on input line 87.
TODO: More formal wording in file abstract.tex on input line 40.
TODO: Fix runon sentence in file abstract.tex on input line 51.
TODO: Maybe instead use the alternative from the thesis-proposal? in file
abstract.tex on input line 55.
TODO: uniform style in file cover.tex on input line 132.
TODO: rearrange in file cover.tex on input line 133.
TODO: Add more acknowledgments in file cover.tex on input line 135.
TODO: cite various grants in file cover.tex on input line 137.
TODO: rearrange in file cover.tex on input line 143.
TODO: how to format citations here in file cover.tex on input line 146.
TODO: cite rewriting in file cover.tex on input line 150.
TODO: should we include acknowledgements from various papers? in file
cover.tex on input line 155.
TODO: Download and fill out \url
{https://libraries.mit.edu/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/umi-proquest-form.pdf} in
file jgross-thesis.tex on input line 106.
TODO: Change biblatex cite format to author-year or something so that it's
easy to pick up references from the paper in file jgross-thesis.tex on input
line 107.
TODO: Share thesis with Eric Marion (cf 2020-05-14 15:53 Facebook Messenger)
in file jgross-thesis.tex on input line 108.
TODO: Share thesis with AndrM-CM-!s KovM-CM-!cs (cf 2020-03-12 11:15 gmail \url

TODO: Share thesis with Talia Ringer and ppedrot in file jgross-thesis.tex on
input line 110.
TODO: single space or dobule space? in file jgross-thesis.tex on input line
TODO: maybe remove ``introduction'' section headings? in file
jgross-thesis.tex on input line 112.
TODO: decide on chapter/section capitalization and be consistent in file
main-files.tex on input line 2.
TODO: figure out if regression stats should be included, and, if so, how to
calculate them in file main-files.tex on input line 3.
TODO: make sure all appendices are at the very end, so we keep a linear
progression in file main-files.tex on input line 4.
TODO: update rewriting paper chapter with camera-ready file before editing in
file main-files.tex on input line 5.
TODO: add labels on every section, ensure no duplicate labels in file
main-files.tex on input line 6.
TODO: Decide whether or not to use contractions (less formal, but okay for
thesis if I make a conscious decision) in file main-files.tex on input line 7.
TODO: be consistent about $\lambda x. body$ vs.~$\lambda x, body$ (note that
Coq only accepts the latter) in file main-files.tex on input line 8.
TODO: move any citations which point at people.csail.mit.edu to point at a
github.io version, and move my personal website there in file main-files.tex on
input line 9.
TODO: maybe include all code in an appendix? in file main-files.tex on input
line 10.
TODO: be consistent about function extensionality vs functional extensionality
in file main-files.tex on input line 11.
TODO: include github code links for contributions in file main-files.tex on
input line 12.
TODO: should I mention the pricing bug on amazon?
https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/2019/07/19/amazon-prime-day-error-sold-13-00
0-camera-equipment-94-report/1775314001/,
https://www.theguardian.com/money/2014/dec/14/amazon-glitch-prices-penny-reprice
rexpress, http://www.michaeleisen.org/blog/?p=358 in file
chap1-introduction.tex on input line 31.
TODO: should I mention anything else? the pentium bug costing Intel \$475
million?
http://top-100s.blogspot.com/2009/05/10-most-expensive-software-blunders.html,
\$500 million Ariane Rocket disaster? ,
https://www.olenick.com/blog/articles/infamous-software-bugs-fdiv-bug in file
chap1-introduction.tex on input line 33.
TODO: should I pull from
https://xavierleroy.org/talks/Milner-award-lecture.pdf? ``Fiat-Chrysler
recalled 1.5 M vehicles for software update.'' in file chap1-introduction.tex
on input line 34.
TODO: find more citiations here in file chap1-introduction.tex on input line
TODO: integrate stuff from extcite {Efficiency1994Boulton} such as ``For
example, much of the research in the field of automated reasoning is concerned
with producing proofs more efficiently'' in file chap1-introduction.tex on
input line 66.
TODO: Related to this is work on sound interfaces to external tools, also an
enduring topic: extcite {TrustedSlind} in file chap1-introduction.tex
on input line 67.
TODO: work on this paragraph in file chap1-introduction.tex on input line 69.
TODO: how to write PhD in text? with periods? not? in file
chap1-introduction.tex on input line 82.
TODO: wide look at various proof assistants (historical overview of how the
field got to where it is today, maybe with weight according to importance) and
successes (applications of proof assistants like compcert, sel4 (kernel),
cakeml, nqthm, ACL2, crypto???, flyspec, 4-color-theorem, odd-order-theorem) in
file chap1-introduction.tex on input line 88.
TODO:
https://www.eeweb.com/profile/adarbari/articles/a-brief-history-of-formal-verifi
cation in file chap1-introduction.tex on input line 89.
TODO: look at OSDI submission (papers/lightbulb/) and mine related work in
file chap1-introduction.tex on input line 90.
TODO: read and cite Talia's paper extcite {ringer2020qed}? in file
chap1-introduction.tex on input line 91.
TODO: introduce section where we talk about what some big design decisions are
and why we might make them the way we do in file chap1-introduction.tex on
input line 94.
TODO: note: target audience: Saman (or POPL/PLDI) in file
chap1-introduction.tex on input line 98.
TODO: explain what dependent types are at all in file chap1-introduction.tex
on input line 99.
TODO: explain the idea of reducing proof checking to typechecking (with
examples) in file chap1-introduction.tex on input line 100.
TODO: explain idea of structuring programming so that some properties are true
by construction in file chap1-introduction.tex on input line 101.
TODO: maybe explain extensional vs intensional in file chap1-introduction.tex
on input line 102.
TODO: maybe mention lego as early implementation of dependent types in file
chap1-introduction.tex on input line 103.
TODO: explain dependent type theory, motivate using it in file
chap1-introduction.tex on input line 104.
TODO: read and cite extcite {Should1999Lamport} and extcite
{Formalising2018Paulson} h/t Karl Palmskog @palmskog on gitter \url
{https://gitter.im/coq/coq?at=5e5ec0ae4eefc06dcf31943f} in file
chap1-introduction.tex on input line 105.
TODO: explain the De Bruijn criterion in file chap1-introduction.tex on input
line 108.
TODO: explain why it's worth following this, and what goes wrong if you don't
in file chap1-introduction.tex on input line 109.
TODO: look into extcite {Sealing2020Selsam} Sealing Pointer-Based
Optimizations Behind Pure Functions in file chap1-introduction.tex on input
line 110.
TODO: example: Ltac vs Gallina, kind-of in file chap1-introduction.tex on
input line 111.
TODO: cite also the rewriter paper in file chap1-introduction.tex on input
line 125.
TODO: read and cite extcite {lean-tactic-language} in file
chap1-introduction.tex on input line 141.
TODO: read extcite {Implementing1998Shao} in file chap1-introduction.tex
on input line 142.
TODO: read extcite {Inductive2003Brady} in file chap1-introduction.tex on
input line 144.
TODO: read extcite {thesis-nogin} in file chap1-introduction.tex on input
line 145.
TODO: read GrM-CM-)goire and Leroy's paper from ICFP 2002 extcite
{Gregoire-Leroy-02} in file chap1-introduction.tex on input line 146.
TODO: read Dirk Kleeblatt's PhD thesis extcite
{Strongly2011Kleeblatt}. in file chap1-introduction.tex on input line 147.
TODO: read Andras Kovacs has smalltt at extcite {smallttKovacs} in file
chap1-introduction.tex on input line 149.
TODO: look at \url {https://github.com/AndrasKovacs/normalization-bench} in
file chap1-introduction.tex on input line 150.
TODO: look at \url {https://github.com/AndrasKovacs/smalltt} in file
chap1-introduction.tex on input line 151.
TODO: ``I haven't yet updated the smalltt repo, but there's a simplified (\url
{https://gist.github.com/AndrasKovacs/a0e0938113b193d6b9c1c0620d853784})
implementation of its evaluator, which seems to have roughly the same
performance but which is much simpler to implement.'' in file
chap1-introduction.tex on input line 152.
TODO:
QUESTION FOR ADAM: Decide on whether to copyright myself or MIT; Adam, are
there considerations to be aware of here? in file jgross-thesis.tex on input
line 105.
QUESTION FOR ADAM: do I need a better citation than wikipedia? in file
chap1-introduction.tex on input line 30.
QUESTION FOR ADAM: should I email Xavier Leroy and ask if he has references on
how much the airline industry spends on testing? in file chap1-introduction.tex
on input line 36.
